content.description: Climbed by stemming and smearing your way half way up till topping out the boulder. An airy step out onto the face and a few clips finishes her up.
content.protection:
Shares anchors with Raw Dog

Bolts
content.location: The bolted route in the left boulder/shield opening just next to Raw Dog.

content.description:
Raw Dog starts with a balancing move to get established on the upper crack where it opens into good hands range. The climbing is pretty splitter for limbstone.

The name comes from an enormous flake that used to span the upper 1/3rd of the crack and made for a super saucy finish on the FA. The flake has since been removed and the climb now protects fully.
content.protection: Small to hands size gear lead to rappel anchor.
content.location: About 50 to 75 yards up canyon from The Centaur is a large shield leaning against the main wall. On the climbers left side of the boulder is a narrow opening with Raw Dog being the crack on the left side of the opening.

content.description: The centaur is the S Shaped crack on the lower end of the Winter wall; requiring a mix of crack and sport skill.
content.protection:
This route was originally aided and then bolted for the free accent. If this was in Ten Sleep it would entirely be bolted.  Although the gear can a little small at times, its all there and when it pinches down its protected with bolts.

Start by stepping up on a lightning struck tree and jam and lie back the first 30 or so feet protecting with small cams and stoppers up to `.75c4. The crux section is protected by 3 bolts and has a couple committing moves. Save a few medium sized pieces to protect to the anchors.
